name: Moevenpick Hotel Nuremberg-Airport

reviews.title: First-class location
reviews.text: You know how difficult it is to find your hotel if you reach the city by car on busy motorways. Not this one - as it is situated at the airport, you just follow the airport sign. There is an underground car park and while the hotel is only a minute's walk from the airport, you do not hear the planes. The hotel's greatest asset is the air-conditioning - quite a rare amenity and probably the only hotel in Nürnberg which has it. Easy access to the city by underground train, free tickets provided by hotel. Very comfortable rooms. Legendary breakfast, to judge from other reviews. Friendly staff giving you help with finding your favourite restaurant in the city (ours is the Maredo, a steak-place). Only thing we did not like was the bar: Too small and smoky. Price reasonable for this great quality place, even on the non-smoking executive floors.

reviews.title: An accidental stay
reviews.text: Like many previous reviewers, we stumbled into the Movenpick. We unwittingly chose to visit Nuremberg during the 2007 Toy Fair, which is huge. This was the only place we could find, and it didn't disappoint.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When it says it is an airport hotel it means it - it is literally opposite the airport. Despite this, we heard no airport noise at all inside, and it was quite interesting watching planes come and go at breakfast. The hotel gives you free train tickets into town, and the trains are very efficient. Desk staff were very helpful in locating a laundrette for us, even though the hotel offered a laundry service. They were very understanding about our desire to avoid paying a small fortune to wash a few T shirts.

reviews.title: Movenpick--a fabulous find!
reviews.text: When you head into Nuremberg, Bar FuBer (sorry, not a German keyboard) on Hallplatz 2 is the best bierkeller we've found in a number of trips to Germany. It's very smoky, although with some non-smoking areas, but the food and drink is great. This is the best schnitzel you'll have.

My husband and I chose to stay at the Movenpick at the airport on the last night of a two-week trip due to an early flight. Although the hotel appears to be a typical chain hotel, we were quite impressed with the service and the room. The service was great, and we were offered free metro tickets from the airport to downtown Nuremberg. The room was nice and efficient and had the only bathtub we had during that trip! The hotel even provides scented bath salts. After a long trip it felt wonderful to soak in a tub! Another unexpected bonus was the free breakfast for those of us with early flights. While small (croissants, coffee and orange juice) it was nice to have something available at 4:30 a.m. before we walked over to the airport.
reviews.title: Quite Impressed with the Movenpick
Very impressive hotel
reviews.text: While we would have preferred to stay in old town Nuremberg (which we were very impressed with), I wouldn't hesitate to stay in the Movenpick again.

reviews.title: A wonderful experience
reviews.text: My husband and I were returning from a river boat cruise down the Danube River and decided to spend 1 extra night in Nuremberg. I found this hotel on the internet because of its location to the airport, (we had a very early flight the next morning)
